back_cards.definition_en: Used to specify a particular noun that is known to the speaker and listener.
back_cards.example_en: The dog barked at the mailman.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a specific item in a known context.
back_cards.example_en: Please pass me the salt from the table.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates a unique object or person.
back_cards.example_en: The president addressed the nation yesterday.

back_cards.definition_en: Used before a singular noun representing a class or group.
back_cards.example_en: The tiger is a majestic animal.

back_cards.definition_en: Points to something previously mentioned.
back_cards.example_en: I saw a movie; the plot was thrilling.

back_cards.definition_en: Used with a superlative to indicate uniqueness.
back_cards.example_en: She is the best singer in the choir.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a specific time period.
back_cards.example_en: The 1980s were a time of big hair.

back_cards.definition_en: Used with a proper noun for emphasis.
back_cards.example_en: This is the Chicago I love.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates a specific part of something.
back_cards.example_en: The engine of the car needs repair.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to generalize about a group.
back_cards.example_en: The elderly often need extra care.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a specific place.
back_cards.example_en: The park is full of blooming flowers.

back_cards.definition_en: Used with an adjective to describe a group.
back_cards.example_en: The poor deserve our compassion.

back_cards.definition_en: Points to a specific event.
back_cards.example_en: The concert last night was amazing.

back_cards.definition_en: Used with a musical instrument in a performance context.
back_cards.example_en: She plays the piano beautifully.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a specific body part.
back_cards.example_en: The doctor examined the patient’s knee.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to indicate a specific day.
back_cards.example_en: The meeting is scheduled for the 15th.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a specific organization.
back_cards.example_en: The United Nations promotes peace.

back_cards.definition_en: Used with a singular noun to represent a profession.
back_cards.example_en: The lawyer defended the case well.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates a specific season.
back_cards.example_en: The spring brings colorful blooms.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a specific meal.
back_cards.example_en: The dinner was delicious tonight.

back_cards.definition_en: Used with a geographical feature.
back_cards.example_en: The Rockies are stunning in autumn.

back_cards.definition_en: Points to a specific book or work.
back_cards.example_en: The Bible is a sacred text.

back_cards.definition_en: Used with a specific building.
back_cards.example_en: The library is open until 8 PM.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a specific era.
back_cards.example_en: The Renaissance was a cultural rebirth.

back_cards.definition_en: Used with a specific invention.
back_cards.example_en: The telephone changed communication.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates a specific subject or field.
back_cards.example_en: The science of biology fascinates me.

back_cards.definition_en: Used with a specific holiday.
back_cards.example_en: The Fourth of July is a big celebration.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a specific team.
back_cards.example_en: The Lakers won the game last night.

back_cards.definition_en: Used with a specific river.
back_cards.example_en: The Mississippi River is very long.

back_cards.definition_en: Points to a specific moment.
back_cards.example_en: The moment she walked in, everyone smiled.

back_cards.definition_en: Used with a specific disease.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a specific weather condition.
